column4: hello.. am i the only one who feel that 9.10 boot time is a lot slower than 9.04??
mines faster in karmic, mind you I dont reboot much
hmm. ok... somehow i feel that it is a lot slower
if you run:   dmesg | less    look at the times on the left as you scroll, if there are any big jumps in time, that is your issue
: 0.003144 <--- does this mean 0.003144 secs?
the left of the decimal place is seconds
: thx!
runs fine here, is your system fairly fast or is it like mine and a dinosaur
its fairly fast......... and it was ok with 9.04... btw..... its just the boot up time that is ridiculously slow....... and logging in to gnome is like talking to my grandma
some have said that, its meant to be sped / speeded (never worked that one out and I'm english) up though
have a read through:   dmesg | less     and note the time on the left side, big gaps show you where problems are
really? is there some sort of doco that explains how to do this 'speed up' ?
not sure, i havent dug around that way much as i just let it do its thing
slow boot can definately be diagnosed with dmes though
hmmm... authenticating with wlan0
don't flood dude, use pastebin
looks like your wifi driver is slowing down the show, you can run:   sudo lshw -C network   to find the chip and find some guides to get you righted
hmmm.. this doesnt happen in 9.04 though......
and it is slow only on cold login..
i.e. if i log out now, and log back in.. its quite snappy
different kernel dude, may even be a bug with the module it uses
9.04 uses 9.04 kernel and 9.04 kernel modules, karmic uses a different kernel and modules
